# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/win32-x64/lldb/lib/encodings/iso8859_8.py
@source-hash: 4cf9e8a8bbe04acc
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:10:54Z

## Purpose
Python codec implementation for ISO 8859-8 (Hebrew) character encoding, providing bidirectional conversion between Unicode and ISO 8859-8 byte sequences. Auto-generated from official Unicode mapping tables.

## Key Components

### Codec Classes
- **Codec (L9-16)**: Base codec with `encode()` and `decode()` methods using charmap encoding/decoding
- **IncrementalEncoder (L17-20)**: Incremental encoding support for streaming data
- **IncrementalDecoder (L21-24)**: Incremental decoding support for streaming data
- **StreamWriter (L25-27)**: Stream-based writing interface (inherits from Codec and codecs.StreamWriter)
- **StreamReader (L28-30)**: Stream-based reading interface (inherits from Codec and codecs.StreamReader)

### Registration Function
- **getregentry() (L33-43)**: Returns CodecInfo object for codec registration with Python's encoding system, mapping 'iso8859-8' name to all codec classes

### Character Mapping Tables
- **decoding_table (L47-304)**: 256-entry tuple mapping byte values (0x00-0xFF) to Unicode characters
  - ASCII range (0x00-0x7F): Direct ASCII mapping
  - Control characters (0x80-0x9F): Preserved as-is
  - Extended range (0xA0-0xBE): Latin-1 supplement with Hebrew-specific substitutions
  - Hebrew letters (0xE0-0xFA): Hebrew alphabet Unicode codepoints (U+05D0-U+05EA)
  - Unmapped positions: Use '\ufffe' (invalid character marker)
  - Directional marks (0xFD-0xFE): Left-to-right and right-to-left marks

- **encoding_table (L307)**: Reverse mapping built from decoding_table via `codecs.charmap_build()`

## Dependencies
- **codecs**: Python standard library for codec implementations

## Architecture Notes
- Follows standard Python codec pattern with separate classes for different use cases
- Uses charmap-based encoding for O(1) character lookup
- Hebrew text support includes proper bidirectional text markers
- Generated code ensures consistency with Unicode standards
- Error handling delegated to underlying charmap functions with configurable error modes
